etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "hand") + tool -> hand holding a tool -> stylized as 卜(卜) (bǔ, "divine")
etymology.interpretation: The character 攴 originally depicted a hand holding a tool or weapon, indicating the action of hitting. Over time, the tool part evolved into the stylized form 卜, which serves a phonetic function, but the overall meaning still relates to striking or tapping.

examples.chinese: 他轻轻攵了门(他輕輕攵了門)。
当电话响起时(當電話響起時)，他用手指攵了桌子(他用手指攴了桌子)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng diànhuà xiǎngqǐ shí, tā yòng shǒuzhǐ pū le zhuōzi.
examples.english: When the phone rang, he tapped the table with his finger.
